name: 8.11"Feeble Attraction" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.text: During what season did this episode take place?
questions.explanation:
winter.

	Woody kept talking about how the day was the coldest day in Boston's history except for one other day. He drove everyone crazy because he kept talking about it.

desk.

	It turned out the desk once belonged to a famous writer. Rebecca destroyed the desk looking for something in it.

questions.text: Who did Frasier say Norm was firing?
options: some lady who didn't do her job right
questions.explanation:
the Morton Salt Girl.

	The woman Norm fired wore a yellow raincoat and hat and very much did resemble the Morton Salt Girl. Frasier couldn't believe Norm was firing her.

questions.text: What was the name of the woman Norm fired?
questions.explanation:
Doris.

	Doris was played by Cynthia Stevenson. She was born August 2, 1962.  Doris was a dedicated worker. So dedicated she knew Norm's entire schedule and was pretty much stalking him after he fired her. She thought she was in love with him.

questions.text: When Woody said, "Jack Frost nipping at your nose?", how did Norm reply?
questions.correct: "Yep. Now let's get Joe Beer nipping at my liver."
options: "What are you talking about? It's beautiful out today."
"He sure is. It's freezing out there!"
"Shut up and give me a beer."
questions.explanation:
"Yep. Now let's get Joe Beer nipping at my liver."

	Norm always had good answers when he first walked in and they asked him something. It was almost always related to getting a beer.

questions.text: What song did the woman Norm fired sing?
questions.explanation:
"Seasons in the Sun".

	"Seasons in the Sun" is a remake of the song "Le Moribond" by Jacques Brel. The English version, "Season in the Sun" words were written by Rod McKuen. The lyrics are as follows:"We had joy, we had funWe had seasons in the sunBut the hills that we climbed were just seasonsOut of time."

a trip to Hawaii.

	A radio program asked what the coldest day in Boston's history was. Carla called and gave the phone to Woody, who gave the correct answer. However, he kept going on and on about it and the radio announcer said, "Hey Woodman, shut up". Woody thought he won a t-shirt until Carla told him he was going to Hawaii. He responded, "It's not cold there, suckers!"

questions.text: What did Rebecca think was hidden in her present from Robin?
questions.explanation:
an engagement ring.

	Rebecca destroys the desk looking for that ring. She never did find it, because he didn't put an engagement ring in the desk.

options: "Ugliest man ever to walk the Earth"
questions.explanation:
"Go no-where loser".

	Frasier explained to Norm that Doris obviously suffers from a low self-esteem. He then explained that was the reason she would fall for a "go no-where loser". He told Norm he didn't mean any offense. Norm replied, "Why would I take offense at that?"

questions.text: Who did the present Rebecca received from Robin once belong to?
questions.explanation:
George Bernard Shaw.

	The ring on the desk came from a tea cup Shaw had set on the desk while writing the 5th act of "Man and Superman". The desk was worth a lot of money, but since Rebecca destroyed it it was not worth anything.
